metadata.title: CVE-2020-8694 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient access control in the Linux kernel driver for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-183-generic - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-lowlatency - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-3.13.0-183-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-183-generic - 3.13.0-183.234
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-183-lowlatency - 3.13.0-183.234
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-183.234').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-194.226~14.04.1').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
